body.ab:
In the name of god: amen the xxviijth
daye of Maye a thousand ffyue hundred nynetie one Elizabeth & Regine : xxxiij I Iohn
Moger Citizen and Cooke of London being whole of Bodie and of perfect minde and ~ ~
Remembraunce praise be giuen to Almightie god but yet doubtefull of the Lordes ~ ~
visitacõn and allso my Suddeyne callinge by deathe do constitute and ordeyne ~
this my last will and testament in manner and forme followinge. ffirst I ~ ~
bequeathe my soule vnto the handes of Almightie god my heauenlye father ~
and to Iesus xp̅iste his onlie sonne my Redemer with thassisance of the holie ghost
my daylie Sanctifier in whome and by whome I hope to be in the nomber of the ~
Elete at the generall Resurrection vntill which tyme I committ my Bodie to the earth
Item I will and bequeathe vnto my Brother william Moger Citizen and Cooke of
London all my lande in Bromley in the Countie of Kente that hath ben in varyaunce
betwene hym and me and to his heires for euer. Item I giue and bequeathe vnto my ~
Cosin Oliver Moger the younger sonne of Oliver Moger deceased all y Landes in
Nockoll in the countie of Kente which was my ffather in lawe John Myborn ^ yeoman ? deceased
to hym and to his heires males of his Bodie lawfullie begotten. And for want
of suche yssue of heires males of his bodie lawfullie begotten I do giue my saied landes
in Nockell vnto ffedricke his brother and to the heires males of his Bodie law=
fullie begotten. And for defaulte of suche yssue then I giue and bequeathe my saied
Landes in Nockell vnto Robert Moger his brother: and to the heires males of his
Bodie lawfullie begotten. And for wante of suche heires males of theire Bodies ~
lawfullie begotten then I will and bequeathe my saied Landes in Nockell to my ~
Brother william and his heires for euer. Item I giue and bequeathe to Oliver ~
Moger the younger the somme of twentie pounde to be paied vnto hym when he
shall accomplishe or come to his full age of one and twentie yeres. Item I do giue
and bequeathe vnto ffredricke Moger his Brother the somme of twentie poundes ~
when he shall come to his full age of one and twentie yeres. Item I giue and bequeathe
vnto Robert Moger his Brother the somme of twentie poundes to be paied vnto hym
when he shall accomplishe his full age of one and twentie yeres. Item I do giue and
bequeathe vnto Margaret Moger theire Sister the somme of twentie poundes when
she shall come to her full age of twentie yeres or at the daye of her marriage. Item
I do giue and bequeathe vnto her Sister ffrauncis Moger the somme of twentie
poundes when she shall come to her full age of twentie yeres or at the daye of her
marriage. Item I do giue and bequeathe vnto Iohn Halpenye sonne of Iohn ~
Halpenye of Orpington in the countie of Kent the Somme of twentie poundes
when he shall come to his full age of one and twentie yeres. Item I giue and ~
bequeathe vnto Henry Halpenye his Brother the somme of twentie poundes to be
paied vnto hym when he shall come to his full age of one and twentie yeres. Itm
I do giue and bequeathe vnto Andrewe Halpenye the somme of twentie poundes
to be paied vnto hym when he shall come to his full age of one and twentie yeres
Item I do giue and bequeathe vnto Agnes halpenye theire sister the somme of
twentie poundes to be paied vnto her when she shall come to her full age of twenty
yeres of at the daye of her marriage. Allse my will and intente ys that none
of them shall sell any of their porcoñs of money or Legacey be me giuen before ~
they shall come to theire full ages yf he she or any of them shall so happen to doe
Then my will and intente is that he she or they which so dothe shall have no porc̃on
of money or legacey by me giuen to them. And allso my will is that yf any of
them happen to die them my will is that he or she whoe dyeth then his of her ~
porc̃on so dyinge shall remayne and to be Deuided amongest the rest porc̃on and
porc̃on like. Item I do giue vnto twentie of my ffellowes men and women of þe
poorer sorte tenne poundes to be deuided amongest them and to be paied vnto them within
twentie dayes after my decease. Item I do will and allso bequeathe vnto them within
that my executors and ouerseers hereunder named shall see that all theise my Legaceys
and porc̃ons of money giuen to the children shall after my decease be put forthe to
be ymployed for theire most advauntage and allso taking good suerties and Bandes
for the payment thereof accordinge to my true meaninge and truste in them. All
the rest of my goodes vnbequeated my Legacys paied my ffunerall dischard god
and my Bodie broughte honestlie to the grounde the one halfe I do giue to be given
and deuided amongest the poore of the parishe of Brumley in the countie of Kent
And the other halfe to be devided amongest my Bretheren and Sisters children ~
aforesaied portion and portion like. All whiche goodes vnbequeathed to be sould
and so deuided and giuen aswell to the poore as to my Bretheren and Sisters ~ ~
children: and to be deuided and given by my executors and ouerseers. And of ~
this my last will and testament I do ordeyne and make Iohn Sonckey gentleman one of
my executors: And I do giue vnto hym for his paynes the somme of tenne poundes. And
I do make another of my executors Iames Blandcharde citizen and draper of Londõ
and I do giue vnto hym for his paynes ffyue poundes. Allso I do make my ouerseers ~
william Moger Citizen and Cooke of London and Iohn kinlye of Grenewiche in the
countie of Kent yeoman and do giue vnto them the Somme of ffyue poundes. Item
I do by this my will and last testamente forgiue all and all manner of persons that
oweth vnto me any somme or sommes of money be yt by bill or obligac̅on that is vndꝛ
three pounde sixe shillinges eighte pence. Item I do giue vnto my ffellowe Iohn ~
Osmonde all my chests and upparell in my chaumber in the Rolles. In witnesse
hereof to this my last will and testamente I haue put to my hande and seale the
daie and yere abouewritten and in the presentes of vs hereundernamed Sealed signed
and deliuered in the presence of vs Geoffrey yate Ro? kighleye / ~ / ~ / Iohn Moger
